title: Submit new studies or modifications
text:
Please contact us to add new studies or to suggest modifications.
Email benzipperer@gmail.com for private correspondence, or you can publicly file an issue at the underlying Github repository.
We welcome your feedback if we have inadvertently omitted a study or failed to select the best estimate from a given paper. The repository is a living document that we will regularly update.

title: Documentation
text:
The own-wage elasticity (OWE) of employment measures the proportional change in a group’s employment caused by a minimum wage increase, divided by the proportional change in that group’s average wage.
The Minimum Wage Own-Wage Elasticity Repository contains a representative estimate of the OWE of employment from every minimum wage study published since 1992, with the following restrictions:

the study must evaluate the employment effects of changes in the statutory minimum wage
the study must estimate a statistically significant, positive wage effect of the minimum wage, in addition to estimating the employment effect, for the same group of workers using a similar research design
the study must be published after 1992 and include “quasi-experimental” or “experimental” variations
studies older than 10 years must have been published in an academic journal
the study must focus on the United States, United Kingdom, countries in the European Union, or Canada (we will eventually relax this restriction)

The current version of the repository, Version 1.1.0, contains 90 studies, 74 of which are published in peer-reviewed journals. A description of Version 1.0 of the repository is in the paper






Paper



Arindrajit Dube and Ben Zipperer. 2024. “Own-Wage Elasticity: Quantifying the Impact of Minimum Wages on Employment”. Working Paper. NBER Working Paper 32925.


For more information, explore a table of all the studies or download the underlying data. Please don’t hesitate to submit any corrections or studies we have accidentally omitted.
If you use the data or this site in your own work, please reference or cite it:






Repository source



Arindrajit Dube and Ben Zipperer. 2024. Minimum wage own-wage elasticity repository, Version 1.1.0. https://economic.github.io/owe

title: Changelog
text: Archived releases of the data, and the code used to generate them, are available on Github.

title: Changelog
text:
Version 1.1.0

Added Bossler Shank 2023 and Garcia-Louzao Tarasonis 2023

title: Changelog
text:
Version 1.0.0

First public release of the data.

title: Changelog
text:
Version 0.16.0

Added Brummund and Strain 2020
Removed Belman Wolfson 2010 due to time series variation only

title: Changelog
text:
Version 0.15.0

Updated estimate from Wiltshire et al 2024
Moved Butcher and Dickinson 2023 to working paper status
Updated bibliography info for Godøy et al 2024 and Azar et al 2023

title: Changelog
text:
Version 0.14.0

Added Eriksson and Pytlikova 2004; Huet-Vaughn and Piqueras 2023; Vadean and Allan 2021; van Beezooijen, van den Berge, and Salomons 2024

title: Changelog
text:
Version 0.13.0

Added Harasztosi and Linder 2019, Manning and Wilson 2004, vom Berge and Frings 2019
Updated bibliography for Giupponi Joyce Lindner Waters Wernham Xu 2024

title: Changelog
text:
Version 0.12.0

Added Rao and Risch 2024
Updated working paper Jha Neumark Rodridguez-Lopez 2023 to published in 2024

title: Changelog
text:
Version 0.11.0

Added Manning 2021 and Sabia 2009b
Updated Vergara 2023
